qas.question: The churches of which desert decorated their monasteries with mosaics?
When was the Monastery of Martyrius created?
When was the Monastery of Martyrius re-discovered?
Where in the Monastery of Martyrius is the most important mosaic work?
What was the name of the monastery that was discovered in 1930?

context: The monastic communities of <a0_0>the Judean<a0_0/> Desert also decorated their monasteries with mosaic floors. The Monastery of Martyrius was founded in <a1_0>the end of the 5th century<a1_0/> and it was re-discovered <a2_0>in 1982–85<a2_0/>. The most important work of art here is the intact geometric mosaic floor of <a3_0>the refectory<a3_0/> although the severely damaged church floor was similarly rich. The mosaics in the church of the nearby <a4_0>Monastery of Euthymius<a4_0/> are of later date (discovered in 1930). They were laid down in the Umayyad era, after a devastating earthquake in 659. Two six pointed stars and a red chalice are the most important surviving features.
